p: It is important to understand workers’ perceptions on workplace extreme heat exposure in a warming climate, as this information may provide evidence for updating heat prevention strategies to reduce the impact of climate change on workers’ health and safety. However, most of the currently available information is from qualitative studies in middle-low income countries [ 24– 26]. Limited evidence suggests that workers’ perceptions regarding likely increasing extreme heat exposure due to climate change in high income countries are not optimistic [ 11]. This survey is a modest step to investigate workers’ heat risk perceptions in a developed country, using a quantitative approach.
